intro: Voacanga bracteata, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a tropical shrub native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain hard, black seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
